intro: Ceratophyllum aquaticum, commonly known as coontie or water crown, is a unique aquatic plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a submerged or floating plant with feathery, branching stems that resemble the shape of a coconut. The plant lacks true leaves and instead has small, scale-like structures that aid in gas exchange. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are pollinated by insects and birds. Ceratophyllum aquaticum is often used in aquariums and ponds due to its ability to oxygenate water and provide habitat for aquatic life.
